meanings.definition: To join together again by splicing.
meanings.sent1: I respliced the broken rope to make it whole again.
meanings.sent2: She respliced the film reel to fix the movie.
meanings.sent3: The tailor respliced the torn seam to save the dress.
meanings.sent4: He respliced the wires, connecting them like a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic respliced the engine, making it run smoothly once more.

meanings.definition: To repair or mend by splicing.
meanings.sent1: The handyman respliced the electrical cord to make it safe.
meanings.sent2: They respliced the torn banner to make it look new.
meanings.sent3: The chef respliced the recipe, adding a new twist.
meanings.sent4: She respliced the broken friendship, bringing them back together.
meanings.sent5: The artist respliced the painting, enhancing its beauty.
